TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ModelMetadata extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a container for metadata for a model.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The word *model* is used differently in the context of this class than it is typically used elsewhere. In an ASP.NET Web Forms application, the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelBindingContext.ModelType%2A> attribute of a data-bound control specifies the type of a data element that the data control is bound to. This type is typically referred to as the model, and it typically corresponds to a row in a database table. The properties of the model typically correspond to columns of the table.
A <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object can provide metadata for the model itself or for a property of the model, or for a property of a complex property. When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to a property, the word *model* refers to the property, and the word *container* refers to the model.
For example, the model might be **Contact**, which has **Name** and **Age** properties, and the **Name** property might be a complex property composed of **FirstName** and **LastName**. When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to the **Contact** object, the model type is **Contact** and there is no container. When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to the **Name** property, the model type is **Name** and the container type is **Contact**. When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to the **FirstName** property, the model type is **FirstName** and the container type is **Name**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be used to provide additional information about the type of data that is stored by the model. For example, if the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.ModelType%2A> property is set to <xref:System.String>, this property might be "EmailAddress" or "Url" - that is, a name that indicates more than just that the data is typed as a string.

Docs.summary: Returns text to display as the name of the model in UI.
Docs.returns: Text to display as the name of the model in UI. The default is the value of the property if that value is not . If the property is , the default value is the value of the property. If the property is , the default value comes from the property of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual string GetSimpleDisplayText ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetSimpleDisplayText() cil managed
Protected Overridable Function GetSimpleDisplayText () As String
protected: virtual System::String ^ GetSimpleDisplayText();
abstract member GetSimpleDisplayText : unit -> string override this.GetSimpleDisplayText : unit -> string

Docs.summary: Returns text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object.
Docs.returns:
The property value is derived by examining the following sequence of related values until a return value is found.
1. If the property value is not , that value is returned.
2. If the property is , the property value is returned.
3. If an attempt to convert the property to a string returns , an empty string is returned.
4. If the string conversion of the property value is the same as the property of the property type, that value is returned.
5. If there are no properties in the collection, an empty string is returned.
6. If none of the preceding tests have returned a value, the return value comes from the first property in the collection. If the property of the first property is , the property value is returned; otherwise the result of converting the first property's property to a string is returned.
